text:
I’m having trouble getting Documenter to pick up changes to docstrings when I build docs locally. I can see Markdown changes I make to rest of the documentation, but the built docstrings are stuck on an older version.

Is there a good way to debug this?

elements.text:
I’m having trouble getting Documenter to pick up changes to docstrings when I build docs locally. I can see Markdown changes I make to rest of the documentation, but the built docstrings are stuck on an older version.

Is there a good way to debug this?

text: What do you mean with "I can see changes made to the .md files?"

elements.text: What do you mean with "I can see changes made to the .md files?"

text: just that I can see Markdown changes I make to the docs. the docstrings are the only thing not updating properly

elements.text: just that I can see Markdown changes I make to the docs. the docstrings are the only thing not updating properly

text: Ok, I misread maybe. Do you use Revise and/or restart Julia between runs?

elements.text: Ok, I misread maybe. Do you use Revise and/or restart Julia between runs?

text: Yes, I’ve restarted Julia a few times in between. However, I’m building the docs from the shell via `julia --project=docs docs/make.jl`

elements.text: Yes, I’ve restarted Julia a few times in between. However, I’m building the docs from the shell via

text: Sorry if this is too silly to mention, but could it be a browser caching issue?

elements.text: Sorry if this is too silly to mention, but could it be a browser caching issue?

text: Do you have the correct version of your package installed to `docs/Project.toml`?

elements.text: Do you have the correct version of your package installed to

text: it’s a good question. I don’t think so, since I’m seeing other changes show up

elements.text: it’s a good question. I don’t think so, since I’m seeing other changes show up

text: that was it - thanks for the catch!
